# Create user like system:admin in OCP 3.x

## Generate Private Key
```
# openssl genrsa -out ayush.key 2048
```

## Generate Certificate Signing Request
```
# openssl req -new -key ayush.key -out ayush.csr -subj "/O=system:masters/O=system:cluster-admins/CN=ayush"
```

## Create an extension file conatining required x509 extensions
```
# cat extension.ext 
keyUsage             = critical,digitalSignature,keyEncipherment
extendedKeyUsage     = clientAuth
basicConstraints     = critical,CA:false
```

## Sign the CSR with /etc/origin/master/ca.crt
```
# openssl x509 -req -in ayush.csr -CA /etc/origin/master/ca.crt -CAkey /etc/origin/master/ca.key -CAcreateserial -out ayush.crt -days 730 -sha256 -extfile extension.ext
```

## Encode the certificate in base64 format without line wrapping(keep content in single line)
```
[root@aygarg-master-1 cert]# cat ayush.crt | base64 -w 0

```

## Encode the private key in base64 format without line wrapping(keep content in single line)
```
[root@aygarg-master-1 cert]# cat ayush.key | base64 -w 0

```

## Edit the ~/.kube/config file as follows
```
[root@aygarg-master-1 cert]# cat ~/.kube/config
apiVersion: v1
clusters:
- cluster:
    certificate-authority: /etc/origin/master/ca.crt
    server: https://aygarg-external.lucifer.com:443
  name: aygarg-external-lucifer-com:443
contexts:
- context:
    cluster: aygarg-external-lucifer-com:443
    namespace: default
    user: ayush/aygarg-external-lucifer-com:443
  name: default/aygarg-external-lucifer-com:443/ayush
- context:
    cluster: aygarg-external-lucifer-com:443
    namespace: default
    user: system:admin/aygarg-external-lucifer-com:443
  name: default/aygarg-external-lucifer-com:443/system:admin
current-context: default/aygarg-external-lucifer-com:443/system:admin
kind: Config
preferences: {}
users:
- name: system:admin/aygarg-external-lucifer-com:443
  user:
    client-certificate-data: 
    client-key-data: 
- name: ayush/aygarg-external-lucifer-com:443
  user:
    client-certificate-data: 
    client-key-data: 
```

## Login to the cluster with new user
```
[root@aygarg-master-1 cert]# oc login -u ayush
Logged into "https://aygarg-external.lucifer.com:443" as "ayush" using existing credentials.

You have access to the following projects and can switch between them with 'oc project <projectname>':

    cases
    custom-scc
  * default
    kube-public
    kube-service-catalog
    kube-system
    management-infra
    openshift
    openshift-ansible-service-broker
    openshift-console
    openshift-infra
    openshift-logging
    openshift-node
    openshift-sdn
    openshift-template-service-broker
    openshift-web-console
    ruby-test
    sso-app-demo
    test

Using project "default".
```
